oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-12-03 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 3, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer) with Kathy Copas and Floyd Robinson, guest performer Jim Reeves, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, Don Slayman, and Gordon Terry. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cowboy Copas; Old Hickory Singers; Jim Reeves; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Cowboy Copas -- Gone And Left Me Blues (Cowboy Copas) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Turn Your Damper Down (Old Hickory Singers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Jim Reeves -- I've Lived A Lot In My Time (Jim Reeves) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Mississippi Sawyer (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- From The Manger To The Cross (Cowboy Copas) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Cowboy Copas) -- Prince Albert jingle (Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Chet Atkins -- Jingle Bells (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Copas, Cowboy; Copas, Kathy; Robinson, Floyd; Brasfield, Rod; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Atkins, Chet; Old Hickory Singers; Slayman, Don (Musician); Terry, Gordon; Reeves, Jim
